Location: On NYS 52 At White Sulphur Springs
Marker text: Jonathan Bradley Robertson Came Here From Bridgeport, Conn., 1807, When It Was A Forest Wilderness. He Served In War of 1812

Location: On NYS 97 At Mouth of Mill Brook Near Pond Eddy
Marker text: D. & H. Canal Dry Dock And Basin 1828–1898
Named July 4, 1812, By James Newkirk. First Settler, Capt. John Newkirk, Prior To 1776. First School, 1784, Taught By Mr. Campbell.
Site of First Newspaper, First Printing Office, First Circuit Court, And The First Academy In Sullivan County
Named In Honor of Walter Burling, Director of Ulster And Orange Branch Turnpike, Which Crossed Shawangunk Kill At Newkirk's Mills, 1808

Location: On NYS 17K At West End Old Bridge At Bloomingburgh
Marker text: Bloomingburgh Academy Built 1810, First Teacher Alpheus Dimmick, Principal Samuel Pitts, Union College. Had Many Famous Graduates

Location: On US 209 About 1½ Miles North of Wurtsboro
Marker text: 1757 - One of Chain of Forts Built Under Supervision of James Clinton, Later General Clinton, During French & Indian War

Location: On US 209 About 2 Miles North of Wurtsboro
Marker text: Killed And Scalped Here During French And Indian War, While On Way From Visiting His Daughter At Minisink, To His Home In Rochester

Location: On Town Rd. at Roosa Gap
Marker text: Building Started Before Revolutionary War. Later Owned And Completed By Abraham Roosa Or Son Jacob Who Lived In Cabin On Hill
And House Built About 1750-60 By Tjerck Van Keuren Westbrook. Village of Westbrookville Named In His Honor
